itineraries.title: COMPLETE DISCOVERY OF EL SALVADOR BETWEEN VOLCANOES, BEACHES AND COLONIAL VILLAGES

visits.text: Discovery of San Salvador's historic center: metropolitan cathedral, National Palace and Plaza Gerardo Barrios.
Exploration of the central market to discover local products and Salvadoran crafts.

activities.text: Excursion to El Boquerón National Park and hike to the crater of San Salvador volcano.

visits.text: Discovery of the neo-Gothic cathedral and the theater of Santa Ana.
Exploration of the archaeological site of Tazumal, remnant of Mayan civilization.

activities.text: Hike to Santa Ana volcano with view of the turquoise crater lake.
Walk in Cerro Verde national park to admire the Izalco and Santa Ana volcanoes.
Stop at Lake Coatepeque, swimming and panorama from the viewpoints.

visits.text: Scenic route on the Ruta de las Flores through the villages of Juayua, Apaneca, Ataco and Nahuizalco.
Discovery of the waterfalls of Juayua and walk in the surrounding coffee plantations.

activities.text: Swimming at the thermal waterfall Salto de Malacatiupan.
Participation in the gastronomic festival of Juayua (weekend).

visits.text: Discovery of the Pacific coastline: villages of El Tunco and El Zonte, heart of Surf City.
Visit to La Libertad seafood market and Sunset Park.

activities.text: Surfing lessons on Pacific waves.
Hiking in Walter Thilo Deininger park to observe wildlife and flora.

visits.text: Discovery of El Espíritu de la Montaña viewpoint with panorama over the Gulf of Fonseca.
Exploration of isolated beaches like Playa El Esteron.

activities.text: Sunrise observation over the Gulf islands from the mountain summit.

visits.text: Visit to the revolution museum in Perquín retracing the history of the civil conflict.
Discovery of El Mozote memorial monuments.

activities.text: Hiking to La Olomina and Las Pilas waterfalls in the surrounding mountains.

visits.text: Discovery of the colonial center of Suchitoto and its Santa Lucía church.
Boat ride on Lake Suchitlán and visit to the surrounding islands.

activities.text: Hike to Los Tercios waterfall formed by basaltic columns.
Sunset watching from the lake viewpoints.

seo.h1_title: EL SALVADOR COMPLETE: VOLCANOES, BEACHES AND HIDDEN DEPTHS
seo.intro_paragraph: Climb to Lake Santa Ana, a turquoise crater set in volcanic silence, then taste Juayúa's gourmet atmosphere through the stalls. Reach El Zonte for surf energy, pause at Perquín museum to understand local history, then stroll through Suchitoto and its colonial cobbles facing Lake Suchitlán.
seo.seo_hook: Volcanic craters cradling turquoise lakes, waves breaking beneath cone silhouettes, colonial squares guarding revolutionary memory. El Salvador surprises.
featured_list: Santa Ana: crater lake, volcanic summit
Ruta de las Flores: coffee villages, color
El Zonte: surf culture, pacific waves

itineraries.title: THE ESSENCE OF EL SALVADOR IN ONE WEEK: VOLCANOES, FLOWER VILLAGES AND PACIFIC BEACHES

visits.text: Discovery of the historic center of San Salvador: Gerardo Barrios square, metropolitan cathedral and Palacio Nacional
Visit to Iglesia El Rosario, a masterpiece of modern architecture and colorful stained glass
Walk through Parque Cuscatlán and its memorial to victims of the civil war
Exploration of Mercado Central to discover crafts and local life

activities.text: Guided walking tour of downtown to understand the history and urban planning of San Salvador

visits.text: Hike to the crater of Santa Ana volcano in Cerro Verde National Park
Observation of Lake Coatepeque from the park's viewpoints

activities.text: Guided walk in Cerro Verde with park rangers to observe local fauna and flora

visits.text: Discovery of the Ruta de las Flores: scenic route connecting the villages of Ataco and Apaneca
Stroll through the colorful streets of Ataco, known for their murals
Visit to a coffee plantation in Apaneca

activities.text: Local coffee tasting and roasting process demonstration

visits.text: Hike to the Cascadas de Juayua (the Seven Waterfalls)
Stroll on the central square and discovery of artisan markets

activities.text: Participation in Juayua's gastronomic festival (if weekend)

visits.text: Arrival on the Pacific coast at El Tunco, walk on the volcanic beach
Exploration of rock formations and sea caves accessible at low tide

activities.text: Beginner surf lesson on El Tunco beach

visits.text: Discovery of the coastal village of El Zonte and observation of surfers
Walk to the river mouth and sunset observation

activities.text: Participation in a baby sea turtle release program (seasonal)
Short hike to the Tamanique waterfalls located in the hinterland

visits.text: Free morning on El Zonte beach to enjoy the calm and the Pacific

activities.text: Coastal walk between El Zonte and El Tunco to admire the cliffs and tropical vegetation

seo.h1_title: EL SALVADOR ESSENCE: FLOWER ROUTE TO PACIFIC SURF DREAMS
seo.intro_paragraph: Follow the Ruta de las Flores and its art villages, starting with Concepción de Ataco and its colorful murals. Stop at Juayúa for street flavors, then descend toward El Tunco and El Zonte where the ocean sets the rhythm. Between coffee on volcanic slopes and evenings feet in sand, the atmosphere stays simple and alive.
seo.seo_hook: Coffee blossoms scenting mountain air, murals exploding on village walls, tube waves unfurling beneath volcanoes. The essence of El Salvador.
featured_list: El Tunco: surf scene, beach vibes
Santa Ana: volcanic majesty, crater lake
